item.title: Type conversions in C++
item.description: Implicit conversion Type casting dynamic_cast static_cast const_cast Implicit conversion This will automatically perform when a value is copied to a compatible type. For example: short a = 2000; int b; b = a; The given example is also know as standard conversion Conversions that may not be able to represent the same value If a negative integer value is converted to an unsigned type. E.g. unsigned char a = -1; // a = 255
